articles.author: Friederike Heine, Andreas Rinke
articles.description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz asked Germany's parliament on Monday to declare it has no confidence in him, taking the first formal step towards securing an early national election following his government's collapse.
articles.title: German Chancellor Scholz asks parliament to clear way for snap election

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Hussam Al-Masri
articles.description: Relatives of Palestinians killed by Israel in Khan Younis gathered around their white-shrouded bodies on Monday before carrying them to their graves.
articles.title: Palestinians mourn dead after Israeli strike on Gaza's Khan Younis

articles.author: Timour Azhari
articles.description: The U.N.'s Syria envoy urged an inclusive Syrian transition based on a nine-year-old Security Council resolution during a meeting with the commander of Syria's new administration, Ahmed al-Sharaa, the envoy's office said on Monday.
articles.title: UN envoy meets Syria's Sharaa, urges inclusive transition

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday accused the West of pushing Russia to its "red lines" - situations it has publicly made clear it will not tolerate - and said Moscow had been forced to respond.
articles.title: Putin accuses West of pushing Russia to its "red lines" forcing it to respond

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Emergency workers raced to restore basic services to the French overseas territory, where hundreds or even thousands are feared dead from the most powerful cyclone to hit the Indian Ocean island in nearly a century.
articles.title: French military aid starts to arrive in cyclone-battered Mayotte

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Canada's Finance Minister Chrystia Freeland unexpectedly resigned on Monday, saying she was no longer on the same page with Prime Minister Justin Trudeau about the best path forward for Canada.
articles.title: Canada's finance minister resigns after policy clash with PM Trudeau

articles.author: Andrew Macaskill, Elizabeth Piper
articles.description: Britain's Labour government has pared back an audit of relations with China, four sources with knowledge of the matter said, preparing the way for a less critical report that could help Prime Minister Keir Starmer focus on improving economic ties.
articles.title: Exclusive: Britain pares back secretive China strategy review, seeking closer ties

articles.author: Anna Mehler Paperny
articles.description: Canadian law enforcement officials acknowledge they are limited in what they can do to stop southbound migrants.
articles.title: Canada promised Trump a border crackdown. Easier said than done.

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Women from Sudan's South Kordofan state have been repeatedly raped and some held as sex slaves by fighters from the warring Rapid Support Forces (RSF) and allied militias, Human Rights Watch said in a report published on Monday.
articles.title: Women held as sex slaves in Sudan's South Kordofan, Human Rights Watch says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Extremism, Russia and Iran should not have a place in Syria’s future, EU's foreign policy chief Kaja Kallas told reporters on Monday after meeting with European foreign ministers.
articles.title: Extremism, Russia and Iran have no place in Syria’s future, says EU's Kallas
